body:
Comment 1: 
The problem with this kind of thing is that as much as possible we want all Go programs
to be compilable by all Go compilers.  That means that we want the spec to try to
clearly state which programs can be compiled and which can not.  The spec currently says
"It is an error to specify multiple elements with the same field name or constant key
value."  That is easy to understand and implement in all compilers.  If we use a more
complex spec here, it's harder for all compilers to implement it the same way.
_Labels changed: added **repo-main**, **release-none**._
